update.description:
This adds some bugfixes and minor improvements. It also adds Nima's changes to support the simspark body type. 

To test this pull request, run the "run_agent" test executable (with gtest_filter argument in order to run each test separately) and ensure that each test succeeds. 

Also, visually verify that UTVilla agents can be succesfully loaded onto the field (download here: http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~AustinVilla/sim/3dsimulation/AustinVilla3DSimulationFiles/2015/binary/utaustinvilla.tar.bz2)
update.title: jliang_model_7

when it happens

This adds some bugfixes and minor improvements. It also adds Nima's changes to support the simspark body type. 

To test this pull request, run the "run_agent" test executable (with gtest_filter argument in order to run each test separately) and ensure that each test succeeds. 

Also, visually verify that UTVilla agents can be succesfully loaded onto the field (download here: http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~AustinVilla/sim/3dsimulation/AustinVilla3DSimulationFiles/2015/binary/utaustinvilla.tar.bz2)

content.raw:
I have removed the print statement in 2fb13b8b4a5e

The problem with 
```
#!c++

this->world->Step(1)
```
is that for some reason after executing this statement, Robocup3dsPlugin::Update() is no longer being called every cycle, meaning that the server plugin has essentially stopped running. I do not know the reason why, but I dont believe this is a problem with the plugin or the test. Also, I am not sure if this is the right way to use
```
#!c++

this->world->Step()
```
since I am getting the following warning: 


```
#!c++

[Wrn] [World.cc:730] Calling World::Step(steps) while world is not paused

```

If you want to test the Nao type Zero model, change the following line in GameState.cc 

```
#!c++

defaultBodyType(agentBodyTypeMap.at("NaoOfficialBT"))
```

to

```
#!c++

defaultBodyType(agentBodyTypeMap.at("NaoSimsparkBT"))
```
content.html:
I have removed the print statement in 2fb13b8b4a5e

The problem with 

this->world->Step(1)

is that for some reason after executing this statement, Robocup3dsPlugin::Update() is no longer being called every cycle, meaning that the server plugin has essentially stopped running. I do not know the reason why, but I dont believe this is a problem with the plugin or the test. Also, I am not sure if this is the right way to use

this->world->Step()

since I am getting the following warning: 

[Wrn] [World.cc:730] Calling World::Step(steps) while world is not paused

If you want to test the Nao type Zero model, change the following line in GameState.cc 

defaultBodyType(agentBodyTypeMap.at("NaoOfficialBT"))

to

defaultBodyType(agentBodyTypeMap.at("NaoSimsparkBT"))

Also, visually verify that UTVilla agents can be succesfully loaded onto the field (download here: http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~AustinVilla/sim/3dsimulation/AustinVilla3DSimulationFiles/2015/binary/utaustinvilla.tar.bz2)

content.raw: PR=Pull request.
content.html: PR=Pull request.

content.raw:
OK, I ran the integration tests one by one and they seem to work. I still have some questions before approving this pull request:

* I see the following messages in some of the tests:

```
#!c++
(SelectInput) select failed Success
error receiving msg!
```
Is this expected? If not, can we change/remove the message, it's confusing.

* Usually, a line after loading the world, such as:

`this->world->Step(1)`

triggers the load of the plugins by the physics. This is a good idea because after that, you know that your plugin is running, otherwise you don't have guarantees.

If I enable this line in `run_agent.cc::TestLoadConnectAgent`, the test fails which make me think that we might have some problem or in the test or in the code. jasonzliang, could you take a look at this?

* I can load a team of agents using the utaustinvilla script. If I'am not wrong this is loading the Aldebaran Nao model. How can I test the Nao type Zero model?
content.html:
OK, I ran the integration tests one by one and they seem to work. I still have some questions before approving this pull request:

  • I see the following messages in some of the tests:
(SelectInput) select failed Success
error receiving msg!

Is this expected? If not, can we change/remove the message, it's confusing.

  • Usually, a line after loading the world, such as:

this->world->Step(1)

triggers the load of the plugins by the physics. This is a good idea because after that, you know that your plugin is running, otherwise you don't have guarantees.

If I enable this line in run_agent.cc::TestLoadConnectAgent, the test fails which make me think that we might have some problem or in the test or in the code. jasonzliang, could you take a look at this?

  • I can load a team of agents using the utaustinvilla script. If I'am not wrong this is loading the Aldebaran Nao model. How can I test the Nao type Zero model?

content.raw:
Hey Jason, I saw that in the new description of the pull request you said that @nima_sh 's changes to the model have been added to this pull request. I did a quick comparison and it seems like the RElbow joint limits are different from pull request #31. 

What do you think about keeping the model pull request separated from the bug fix pull request? There are some wrong offsets on the model which we should fix, as I commented on the other PR.
content.html:
Hey Jason, I saw that in the new description of the pull request you said that @nima_sh 's changes to the model have been added to this pull request. I did a quick comparison and it seems like the RElbow joint limits are different from pull request #31.

What do you think about keeping the model pull request separated from the bug fix pull request? There are some wrong offsets on the model which we should fix, as I commented on the other PR.

content.raw: please test the previous <effort> value for the Aldebaran model and control the robot with your tuned PID limits, maybe the simulator will not crash with using step_time 0.01, and also please test the controller using simple behavior, like only keep the robot stand up and command your agent to move its arm slowly to be aligned with it body.
content.html: please test the previous <effort> value for the Aldebaran model and control the robot with your tuned PID limits, maybe the simulator will not crash with using step_time 0.01, and also please test the controller using simple behavior, like only keep the robot stand up and command your agent to move its arm slowly to be aligned with it body.

content.raw: I dont know exactly what is the PR, maybe it is <real_time_update_rate>. In my test on this branch and in Nima_Integration branch, I did not assign the <real_time_update_rate>, so gazebo attempted to run the simulation as fast as possible and the simulation goes faster. we should see the effect of this change in challenging behavior like walking.
content.html: I dont know exactly what is the PR, maybe it is <real_time_update_rate>. In my test on this branch and in Nima_Integration branch, I did not assign the <real_time_update_rate>, so gazebo attempted to run the simulation as fast as possible and the simulation goes faster. we should see the effect of this change in challenging behavior like walking.

content.raw: yes, I think it is possible. In my test I did the reverse, by changing the PID controllers limits, the effect of the effort parameters have been changed. I think these types of the limits should be assigned in one place, e.g. in the SDF file.
content.html: yes, I think it is possible. In my test I did the reverse, by changing the PID controllers limits, the effect of the effort parameters have been changed. I think these types of the limits should be assigned in one place, e.g. in the SDF file.

content.raw: using the ODE's default step size, 0.001 or lower the simulator will not be crashed. If  it doesn't explode, the sample agent will fall and shake since in this branch the Aldebaran NAO model has been used and the sample agent is developed to work with simspark model.

content.raw:
Usually, a line after loading the world, such as:

`this->world->Step(1)`

Triggers the load of the plugins by the physics. This is a good idea because after that, you know that your plugin is running, otherwise you don't have guarantees.

If I enable this line, the `TestLoadConnectAgent` test fails which make me think that we might have some problem or in the test or in the code. @jasonzliang, could you take a look at this?
content.html:
Usually, a line after loading the world, such as:

this->world->Step(1)

Triggers the load of the plugins by the physics. This is a good idea because after that, you know that your plugin is running, otherwise you don't have guarantees.

If I enable this line, the TestLoadConnectAgent test fails which make me think that we might have some problem or in the test or in the code. @jasonzliang, could you take a look at this?

content.raw: All the tests for run_agent.cc pass if you run them one by one, the issue is that for some reason, they do not work if you run them together. I remember we talked about this issue before and you mentioned that it was a problem with the Server Fixture class not tearing down correctly between tests.
content.html: All the tests for run_agent.cc pass if you run them one by one, the issue is that for some reason, they do not work if you run them together. I remember we talked about this issue before and you mentioned that it was a problem with the Server Fixture class not tearing down correctly between tests.

content.raw: @jasonzliang, could you take a look at the `run_agent.cc`? The tests fail and I see a lot of `error receiving msg!` .
content.html: @jasonzliang, could you take a look at the run_agent.cc? The tests fail and I see a lot of error receiving msg! .
